title: Update database schema for NAPLAN scores
description: Extend the schools object in houses.json to include NAPLAN scores. Schema: schools.primary.naplan and schools.secondary.naplan with fields for reading, writing, spelling, grammar, numeracy scores.
close_reason: NAPLAN scores integration complete: scraper implemented in server.js, schema updated with naplan property in schools, UI displays scores in data view and compare pages

title: House Comparison App
close_reason: House Comparison App complete with all features: Data Entry page, Data View page with hub-and-spoke visualization, Google Maps integration, school catchment lookups, train station finder, Flinders St commute calculations

title: JSON Database Schema
description: JSON file-based database for storing property data. Schema includes: address, rooms (bedrooms/bathrooms/garage), price range, auction date, and land area. File will be committed to repo.
close_reason: All implemented: Data Entry page with URL input, JSON schema in houses.json, saveToDatabase() displays JSON for manual copy/commit

title: Property selector for comparison
description: UI component to select up to 4 properties from the database for comparison. Properties must already exist in the database (houses.json). Includes multi-select dropdown or checkboxes to choose properties.

title: Design hub-and-spoke visualization
description: Create star/hub-and-spoke visual with property at center, surrounded by: schools, train station, commute times. Use graphics, icons for clean non-cluttered display. Refer to dataview.png wireframe.
close_reason: Enhanced hub-and-spoke visualization with CSS Grid layout, animated connections, color-coded nodes, hover effects, and responsive design

title: Set up frontend project structure
description: Initialize the frontend-only project. Pure JS with web API calls, no backend server. Will be hosted on koustubh25.github.io.
close_reason: Created frontend project structure with index.html, CSS styles, and JS modules (config, utils, scraper, maps, app)

title: Set up charting library (Chart.js or D3.js)
description: Choose and integrate a charting library for radar/spider charts. Options: Chart.js (simpler, lightweight) or D3.js (more powerful, flexible). Install the library and set up basic configuration for radar chart rendering.

title: Display NAPLAN scores in UI
description: Show NAPLAN scores in: 1) Data View page - add scores to school spoke nodes, 2) Compare page - include NAPLAN in comparison radar chart and metrics table. Style scores with appropriate colors/indicators.
close_reason: NAPLAN scores integration complete: scraper implemented in server.js, schema updated with naplan property in schools, UI displays scores in data view and compare pages

title: Calculate Flinders Street Station travel time
description: Calculate travel time to Flinders Street Station during peak hours on a working day from: (a) the nearest train station, (b) the property address directly.
close_reason: Implemented MapsService.getTravelToFlinders() with peak hour scheduling. Calculates transit, driving, walking routes from property and via nearest station

title: Implement data normalization for radar chart
description: Normalize the 9 comparison metrics to 0-100 scale for radar chart display. Handle different units: count (bedrooms/bathrooms), area (m²), price ($), time (minutes), distance (km). Calculate min/max across selected properties and normalize each metric proportionally.

title: Add interactive hover details to comparison chart
description: Implement hover interactions that show detailed information for each data point on the spider/radar chart. Display actual values (not just normalized) when hovering over chart elements.

title: NAPLAN Scores Integration
description: Add NAPLAN scores for primary and secondary schools. Scrape data from myschool.edu.au which requires accepting terms of use first. Display scores in Data View and Compare pages.
close_reason: All NAPLAN scores integration tasks completed: scraper for myschool.edu.au, database schema update, and UI display in both data view and compare pages

title: Data Entry Page
description: Frontend page for entering realestate.com.au URLs. Includes URL input form, web scraper integration, and JSON storage. Only visible on localhost/127.0.0.1, hidden on production (github.io).
close_reason: All implemented: Data Entry page with URL input, JSON schema in houses.json, saveToDatabase() displays JSON for manual copy/commit

title: Create address dropdown with autocomplete
description: Build dropdown that accepts text input and shows addresses from the JSON database. Center of the Data View page. Can also accept Google Maps locations.
close_reason: Implemented address dropdown with database suggestions and Google Places autocomplete integration

title: Write a technical blog for this app
description:
Now that everything is working as expected, I'd like to write a technical blog which can be published on https://dev.to/ in a maximum part of two part series.

I want to 
1. Make the blog more about the use of `beads` product management tool itself and less about the app we built.
2. You can write briefly about the app we built, also don't mind publishing the links since they are already public.
3. I want to write about how `beads` compares to spec driven development. The good things about it e.g. long memeory because of jsonl files for the llm and committing to git repo, the dependencies between issues, more visibility etc. 
4. Since `beads` is relatively new, I don't mind starting from as basic as the installation process, but the audience is very technical so don't spend too much time on it
5. Include a lot of mermaid diagrams to explain
6. Also, don't hesitate to explain any drawbacks that we saw
5. You can also write about the
acceptance_criteria: A publishable technical blog ready for dev.to
close_reason: Created 2-part technical blog series for dev.to: Part 1 introduces beads and the Mission House app, Part 2 deep dives into JSONL advantages, workflow patterns, real examples, spec-driven comparison, and honest drawbacks. Includes 8 mermaid diagrams throughout.

title: Add modern UI styling and animations
description: Make the app artistic with fancy UI, modern design, graphics, icons, and animations. Focus on the Data View page as the main visual centerpiece.
close_reason: Added modern UI with dark theme, CSS Grid layout, animated hub pulse, color-coded nodes, hover effects, shimmer animations, and responsive design

title: Implement spider/radar chart visualization
description: Create spider/radar chart using hub-and-spoke design pattern to visualize comparison metrics. Chart should support up to 4 properties overlaid on the same chart with different colors. Should be interactive and visually appealing.

title: Create multi-select property UI component
description: Build a multi-select UI component (dropdown or checkboxes) that displays all properties from the database. Show property address and key details (beds/baths, price) for each option. Support selecting multiple properties with visual feedback (checkmarks, highlights).

title: Style Data Comparison page with modern UI
description: Apply artistic, modern UI styling to the Data Comparison page consistent with the rest of the app. Include animations, color coding for different properties, and responsive design.

title: Style comparison page and integrate with existing UI
description: Apply consistent styling to match the existing hub-and-spoke design aesthetic. Ensure the comparison page follows the same modern, artistic UI theme. Add navigation link from main pages. Make the radar chart responsive and visually appealing with proper colors, spacing, and animations.

title: Add hover interactions and detail display
description: Implement hover interactions on the radar chart. When hovering over a data point or thread, show detailed information for that metric: actual values (not normalized), units, and property name. Use tooltips or a detail panel to display this information without cluttering the visualization.

title: Build radar chart with 9 comparison metrics
description: Create the radar chart component displaying all 9 metrics: (1) bedrooms, (2) bathrooms, (3) house area, (4) price midpoint, (5) Flinders St commute time, (6) walk to station, (7) drive to station, (8) primary school distance, (9) secondary school distance. Support overlaying up to 4 properties with different colors/styles.

title: Implement primary school catchment lookup
description: Find primary school in the catchment area using findmyschool.vic.gov.au. Steps: (1) Enter address in #address-search-field, (2) Select latest year (2026), (3) Click 'Primary' radio button. Parse result from #SchoolInfo-header (h2) for school name. Also get school address, phone, and distance from #NearestSchools. Use Google Maps for walking time calculation.
close_reason: Implemented primary and secondary school catchment lookup via SchoolService.getPrimarySchool() and getSecondarySchool() with fallback links to findmyschool.vic.gov.au

title: Data Comparison Page
description: Multi-property comparison page where users can select and compare up to 4 properties from the database using a spider/radar chart visualization with hub-and-spoke design. Comparison metrics: bedrooms, baths, area, price, Flinders St commute time, station walking/driving time, school distances.

title: Calculate and normalize comparison metrics
description: Implement calculation logic for all comparison metrics: bedrooms, bathrooms, area, price (midpoint of range), Flinders St commute time via train, walking time to station, driving time to station, primary school distance, secondary school distance. Normalize values for radar chart display.

title: Design and implement JSON schema
description: Create JSON schema with fields: address, rooms (bedrooms, bathrooms, garage), price (range), auction_date, area (m²). See wireframe dataentrywithdb.png.
close_reason: Implemented JSON schema with fields: address, rooms (bedrooms/bathrooms/carSpaces), price (min/max/displayText), auctionDate, floorPlan (landSize/unit), propertyType

title: Save scraped data to JSON file
description: Implement logic to save scraped property data to the JSON database file. User will manually commit the updated file to the repo.
close_reason: All implemented: Data Entry page with URL input, JSON schema in houses.json, saveToDatabase() displays JSON for manual copy/commit

title: Create initial empty database file
description: Create properties.json with empty array or sample structure for the database.
close_reason: Created initial houses.json database file with sample property data

title: Data View Page
description: Main decision-making page with hub-and-spoke visualization. Displays property info, school catchments (primary/secondary), nearest train station, commute times, and Flinders Street Station travel time. Modern, artistic UI with animations.
close_reason: Implemented Data View Page with hub-and-spoke visualization, property info display, school catchment links, train station info, and Flinders St commute times

title: Implement myschool.edu.au scraper
description: Create Puppeteer-based scraper for myschool.edu.au to fetch NAPLAN scores. Must handle: 1) Accept terms of use (check checkbox #checkBoxTou, click Accept button), 2) Search for school by name, 3) Extract NAPLAN scores from results page. Add to server.js alongside existing school catchment scraper.
close_reason: NAPLAN scores integration complete: scraper implemented in server.js, schema updated with naplan property in schools, UI displays scores in data view and compare pages

title: Implement Google Maps API integration
description: Set up Google Maps API for distances, travel times, and location data. Required for school catchments, train stations, and commute calculations.
close_reason: Added Google Maps API with Places and Geometry libraries. MapsService provides geocoding, directions, nearest station search, and autocomplete

title: Implement web scraper for realestate.com.au
description: Extract property data from realestate.com.au pages using outerHTML parsing. Extract: address (h1.property-info-address), rooms/area (ul.property-info__primary-features), price range (property-info__middle-content with Indicative price).
close_reason: Implemented Scraper.parsePropertyHtml() and scrapeFromUrl() with CORS proxy support. Extracts address, rooms, price, area from realestate.com.au HTML

title: Implement localhost-only visibility for Data Entry
description: Hide the Data Entry page when running on production (github.io). Only show when running on localhost or 127.0.0.1.
close_reason: Implemented localhost-only visibility using Config.isLocalhost() and CSS class 'localhost-only' that hides elements on production

title: Data Comparison Page
description: Page to compare up to 4 properties from the database using a radar/spider chart visualization. Compares properties on 9 metrics: bedrooms, bathrooms, area, price, Flinders St commute time, walk/drive to station, distances to primary and secondary schools.

title: Create property selector for comparison
description: Build multi-select component that allows users to select up to 4 properties from the database for comparison. Should show property addresses and prevent selection of more than 4 properties.

title: Implement secondary school catchment lookup
description: Find secondary school in the catchment area using findmyschool.vic.gov.au. Steps: (1) Enter address in #address-search-field, (2) Select latest year (2026), (3) Click 'Secondary' radio button. Parse result from #SchoolInfo-header (h2) for school name. Also get school address, phone, and distance from #NearestSchools. Use Google Maps for walking time calculation.
close_reason: Implemented primary and secondary school catchment lookup via SchoolService.getPrimarySchool() and getSecondarySchool() with fallback links to findmyschool.vic.gov.au

title: Find nearest train station
description: Identify the nearest train station to the property. Display commute methods with time for each (bus, car, walking) using Google Maps data.
close_reason: Implemented MapsService.findNearestTrainStation() using Google Places API with nearby search for train_station type, includes walking directions to station

title: Fix naplan score web scraping logic
description: Naplan score web scraping not working as expected. Check the rquirements document
acceptance_criteria: Naplan score written in json file as in the requirements document
close_reason: Implemented naplan_quality metric: added benchmark constants, quality calculation function, and UI display in both hub-spoke view and compare page radar chart

title: Create URL input form with submit button
description: Build the input form UI that accepts realestate.com.au links with a submit button. Refer to wireframe dataentry.png.
close_reason: Created URL input form with submit button in Data Entry page for realestate.com.au links

title: Radar/spider chart visualization
description: Build a radar/spider chart to visualize property comparisons. Chart displays 9 metrics: (1) bedrooms, (2) bathrooms, (3) house area, (4) price (use midpoint if range), (5) time to Flinders St via train, (6) walk time to nearest station, (7) drive time to nearest station, (8) distance to primary school, (9) distance to secondary school. Support overlaying up to 4 properties on one chart.

title: Integrate with findmyschool.vic.gov.au
description: Implement integration with https://www.findmyschool.vic.gov.au for school catchment lookups. Input: property address. Output: school name, address, phone, distance. Parse HTML elements: #address-search-field (input), #SchoolInfo-header (school name result), #NearestSchools (distance info). Must handle year selection (choose latest) and school type toggle (Primary/Secondary).
close_reason: Created SchoolService with findmyschool integration. Provides lookup with CORS proxy fallback and direct links to findmyschool.vic.gov.au for manual lookups
